channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for WI
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for WI

item.title: Report X-2024050025
item.description:
Report X-2024050025

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-03T15:12:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-27
  • City: SUPERIOR
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Package was dropped by package handler unloading IB trailer. Package started leaking and was brought to QA for inspection and processing. Shipper should add additional packaging materials and correct labels in the future.

item.title: Report X-2024041492
item.description:
Report X-2024041492

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-02T15:12:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-20
  • City: OAK CREEK
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER RECEIVE A CALL OVER THE RADIO THAT THERE WAS AN LEAKING PACKAGE ON THE BLUE BELT OUTBOUND WALL. RESPONDER APPROACHED PACKAGE DRESSED IN PPE WITH DECISION TREE. AFTER FOLLOWING THE STEP OF THE DECISION PACKAGE WAS SAFE TO TRANSPORT TO THE SERVICE CENTER FOR PROPER INVESTIGATION USING DECISION TREE TO PROCESS PACKAGE.

item.title: Report X-2024041540
item.description:
Report X-2024041540

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-02T15:12:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-17
  • City: BALDWIN
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: PACKAGE WAS BROUGHT INTO THE CUSTOMER COUNTER NEEDING TO BE REWRAPPED. THE SIDE OF PACKAGE HAD LOOKED TO BE IMPACTED LEFT WITH LARGE HOLE. IN THE REWRAP PROCESS, REWRAP; NO LEAK, THE PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED TO CONTAIN BUTANE LIGHTERS. THERE WERE NO HAZ MAT MARKINGS, UNDECLARED.

item.title: Report E-2024040585
item.description:
Report E-2024040585

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-29T15:12:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-28
  • City: JANESVILLE
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SCHNEIDER NATIONAL BULK CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The hose connection was leaking when the driver started his unload. When they hook up they are to do a twist test on the hose to make sure it doesn't spin at all. Any movement indicates either the gasket is bad or the camlocks that lock it down may need to be shimmed. It did not twist when he tried moving it and the gaskets all looked good. After he applied shims though it did stop the leak. We're taking this hose out of use going forward and getting it back to the manufacturer so they can inspect it and replace the fitting on the end. 8 ounces hit the ground beyond the spill bucket.
